title: Ticket #2034: Update docs on automatic environment provided to jobs
description:
Section 2.5.5 (Users' Manual > Submitting a Job > Environment Variables) could use some additional documentation:

  • Job wrapper variables: These may be present if a USER_JOB_WRAPPER is being used. The wrapper script may or may not remove them from the environment before starting the job. See "Limiting Resource Usage" ("sec:Resource-Limits") for more on these. None of these appear in the index; they probably should.
    • _CONDOR_JOB_AD
    • _CONDOR_MACHINE_AD
    • _CONDOR_WRAPPER_ERROR_FILE

The manual page for condor_ssh_to_job could use some additions:

  • _CONDOR_JOB_IWD will be set to the initial working directory for the job.
  • Check section 2.5.5 (Users' Manual > Submitting a Job > Environment Variables). I think you're guaranteed that these are present as well.

The following are present, but are for Condor's internal use. They should not be documented:

  • _CONDOR_ANCESTOR_* where * is a PID - Used for process tracking
  • _CONDOR_JOB_PIDS - used by condor_ssh_to_job, shouldn't be visible here.
  • _CONDOR_JOB_IWD - used by condor_ssh_to_job, shouldn't be visible here.
